revised_title: Acute Muscle Denervation Induced by Bungarotoxin: A Neurotoxin's Impact on Neuromuscular Transmission
tldr: The study investigates the acute muscle denervation caused by p-bungarotoxin, a neurotoxin found in Bungarus multicinctus snake venom. The toxin affects neuromuscular transmission by abolishing the release of acetylcholine and disrupting the structure of the neuromuscular junction. The research provides insights into the mode of action of the neurotoxin and its potential impact on the nervous system.
